summary: The function allows filtering an CSS input image with a set of filter functions. The used filter functions are the same as for the CSS filter property. The filter() function can be animated as well.

summary: The KeyboardEvent |code| attribute contains information about the key event that can use used identify the physical key being pressed by the user.

summary: The KeyboardEvent |key| attribute contains information about the character being generated by the key event.

summary: Retrieve the computed accessible role and name for the element, if any.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Geometry interfaces
summary:
This specification describes several geometry interfaces for the representation of points, rectangles, quadrilaterals and transformation matrices with the dimension of 3x2 and 4x4.

SVGPoint, SVGRect and SVGMatrix will be aliased to new interfaces. Their old methods will be maintained and some new methods are introduced.

In the near future, CSS transform will be updated so they can work directly with the new objects. This avoid parsing on the js side.

visibility: Only a very small number of web developers will care about
name: HTTP Client Hints
summary: Header for proactive content negotiation; just as the Accept header allowed clients to indicate what formats they prefer, Client Hints allow clients to indicate a list of device and agent specific preferences.

locale in KeyboardEvent.
queryKeyCap() and queryLocale() static methods.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: WebVTT Regions
summary:
The WebVTT regions functionality has been recently added to the WebVTT specification. The feature consists of the following web-exposed changes:
*) Public API for creating region objects from script.
*) Advanced positioning and display functionality for subtitles and captions such that FCC requirements are fulfilled.
*) Additional CSS pseudo-element for styling regions.

comments: This is done in WebKit, but still behind a runtime enabled feature last time I checked.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: BroadcastChannel
summary: BroadcastChannel allows scripts from the same origin but other browsing contexts to send each other messages. Channels are scoped to an origin and have a name, messages posted to a channel will be delivered to all listeners of that channel in all documents.

comments:
Positive reception from CSS working group
http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2014Oct/0261.html
visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: CSS Motion Path
summary:
Motion paths allow authors to animate any graphical object along an author-specified path.

The following CSS properties are defined:
motion-path
motion-position
motion-rotation
motion (shorthand)

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Credential Management API
summary: The proposal at http://projects.mikewest.org/credentialmanagement/spec/ describes an imperative API enabling a website to request a user’s credentials in order to sign them in, and to help the user agent correctly store user credentials for future use. In short, it enables cooperation between a website and Blink's embedder's password manager.

comments:
Intent to implement:
Debug.traceAsyncOperationStarting()
Debug.traceAsyncOperationCompleted()
Debug.traceAsyncCallbackStarting()
Debug.traceAsyncCallbackCompleted()
visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Debug API
summary: Expose some Debug API to user's JavaScript code.

comments: API was previously named "Smoothness Timing"
visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Frame Timing API
summary: This specification defines an interface to help web developers measure the rendering performance of their applications in the wild. The API provides frame performance data, as experienced by the end user on their device, to facilitate smoothness measurements (i.e. Frames per Second and Time to Frame). This is done by capturing events for main frame and impl (compositor) thread actions, and exposing them to JavaScript via the Performance Timeline.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Presentation API
summary: Gives ability to access external presentation-type displays and use them for presenting web content.

comments:
Motivation
1. Compositing spec doesn't contain "darker" composite operator.
2. "darker" is a quirk that is exclusive to WebKit.
3. "darker" composite operator is implemented in the same way to "darken" blend mode. So web developers can use "darken" instead of "darker".
visibility: Only a very small number of web developers will care about
name: Remove darker composite operator
summary:
deprecate darker composite operator because Compositing spec [1] doesn't contain "darker" composite operator.
[1] http://dev.w3.org/fxtf/compositing-1

visibility: Only a very small number of web developers will care about
name: Speech Recognition with WebRTC
summary: Chrome supports speech recognition for use cases like voice search and voice input. The API is exposed to web developers via JavaScript's webkitSpeechRecognition object. Current implementation does not support more extensive use cases like video chat transcriptions or video conferencing.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Standby API
summary: The API would prevent the device from entering a power-saving state (e.g. turning off the screen).

comments: This could have compatibility issues as we are changing the data type for existing properties. Some websites may depend on the values being integers.
visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: Subpixel precision for clientWidth, offsetWidth, scrollTop, et al
summary:
The latest draft of the CSS OM spec changed the type for a number of Element and HTMLElement properties from long to float. 

Specifically the following properties:
Element::clientHeight
Element::clientWidth
Element::clientLeft
Element::clientTop
Element::scrollTop
Element::scrollLeft
Element::scrollWidth
Element::scrollHeight
HTMLElement::offsetWidth
HTMLElement::offsetHeight
HTMLElement::offsetTop
HTMLElement::offsetLeft

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Subresource Integrity
summary: Subresource Integrity defines a mechanism by which user agents may verify that a fetched resource has been delivered without unexpected manipulation. In a nutshell, metadata inlined into HTML elements allows the browser to determine whether the resource that was downloaded matches the resource the page's author expected to download.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: Antialiased Clipping in Canvas
summary:
The Canvas spec seems intentionally vague about the antialiasing of clips but:

a) performing antialiased draws but aliased clips seems to defy web developer expectations and
b) most other browsers antialias the canvas clips.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

summary: The arrow (=>) takes the place of the function keyword

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

summary: Extends the CSS sizing properties with keywords that represent content-based "intrinsic" sizes and context-based "extrinsic" sizes, allowing CSS to more easily describe boxes that fit their content or fit into a particular layout context.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

summary: Adds an optional argument to existing scroll APIs that specifies whether scrolling should be smooth. Also adds a CSS property for this.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Cache API for Service Worker
summary: The Cache API consists of additional ServiceWorker APIs which allow authors to fully and conveniently manage their content caches for offline use. An origin can have multiple, named Cache objects, whose contents are entirely under the control of Service Worker scripts.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Canvas hit regions
summary:
Allows the author to establish regions on a canvas 2D context. These regions can be associated with HTML elements and they will inherit their ARIA properties.
In addition, mouse events will be updated so events that fire on a canvas and that hit a region, the id of that region is a member of the event.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

summary: Render a Canvas object (2D or WebGL) from a web worker.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

summary: Add a textDecoration attribute to canvas 2D contexts, behavior similar to existing "font" attribute: It's a DOMString, parsed the same way as corresponding CSS property (text-decoration).

comments: Dart is standardized through ECMA: http://www.ecma-international.org/memento/TC52.htm
visibility: Likely in mainstream tech news
name: Dart VM
summary: Dart is a new web programming language with libraries, a virtual machine, and tools.  It's designed to help developers build fast, structured modern web apps.  Dart compiles to JavaScript to run across the entire modern web. The VM is a Chrome feature to optimize Dart's performance.

Navigator.mediaDevices has
* an enumerateDevices function, which provides the same functionality as MediaStreamTrack.getSources and adds audio output devices to the list, and
* an ondevicechange event to notify when the set of devices available have changed.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Permissions API
summary: The Permissions API allows a web application to be aware of the status of a given permission, to know whether it is granted, denied or if the user will be asked whether the permission should be granted. The purpose of the API is to improve general UX with regards to permissions on the Web, allowing developers to be aware of what is going to happen will enable better flow.

comments: Standards has been drastically changed; it's now based on Service Workers.
visibility: Likely in mainstream tech news
name: Push API
summary: Push API

comments:
There is some leeway on the actual preconnect and it is treated as a hint.  In particular, the number of connections is left to the browser to decide.

In cases where Chrome already has predictor information we may choose to ignore the preconnect hint entirely and use the historical knowledge we have from the predictor.
visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: Resource Hints - preconnect
summary: Adds support for <link rel="preconnect" href="..."> (and the equivalent HTTP link header) as a hint that the browser should predictively open a connection to the supplied server/protocol for resources that will be needed later in the loading process.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

summary: APIs for creating, composing, and consuming streams of data, that map efficiently to low-level I/O primitives, and allow easy composition with built-in backpressure and queuing.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Web MIDI API
summary: Defines an API supporting the MIDI protocol, enabling web applications to enumerate and select MIDI input and output devices on the client system and send and receive MIDI messages.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Web Notifications using Service Workers
summary: Web Notifications have an in-page event delivery model by default, which means that notifications cannot reliably outlive the page's lifetime. Allowing event delivery to be routed to a page's Service Worker provides a solid solution.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: scroll-delay
summary: Give advanced web applications the ability to force scrolling to run synchronously with JavaScript in order to enable scroll-linked effects.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: stale-while-revalidate
summary:
stale-while-revalidate (s-w-r for short) is an HTTP header that defines an extra window of time during which a cache (proxy, user agents) can use a stale asset as long as it revalidates it asynchronously.

This improves subsequent page load latencies as stale assets are non longer in the critical path.

Fetch API is a new API for loading resources in web applications. It's intended to supersede XMLHttpRequest.

Fetch API is already available in ServiceWorker scope. This entry is for announcing its availability in window scope.

name: WebAudio StereoPannerNode
summary:
StereoPannerNode is a audio processing node which positions an incoming audio stream in a stereo image using robust equal-power panning algorithm and sample-accurate automation.

Web Audio API specification has been updated to include a new audio node dedicated to equal-power stereo panning.

comments: The specification for suspend and resume has not yet been finalized, but any changes are expected to be very small.

summary: Supports suspending and resuming an AudioContext to allow applications to pause the audio device when needed.  This reduces CPU usage and power consumption when audio is suspended.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: image-rendering: pixelated
summary: "image-rendering: pixelated" indicates that image should be scaled "so that the image appears to be simply composed of very large pixels", e.g. using nearest-neighbour.

visibility: Only a very small number of web developers will care about
name: ES6 numeric literals
summary: Allows binary and octal numeric literals using 0b101 and 0o753 respectively.

comments:
Re: strongly positive web developer views
 - we are seeing extremely positive feedback whenever there is a talk about SW
 - high profile web developers have already started prototyping with the API
 - overall, everyone we've talked to is eager to see this API shipping.
 - it's one of the top voted FR at IE's user voice page https://wpdev.uservoice.com/forums/257854-internet-explorer-platform
visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Service Worker
summary:
ServiceWorkers (formerly Navigation Controllers) are a new system that provides event-driven scripts that run independent of web pages. They are similar to SharedWorkers except that their lifetime is different and they have access to domain-wide events such as network fetches.

Use cases: offline, reducing perceived page load latency and will eventually power notification/push/sync/... use cases.

comments: See also: https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/368
visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: WebAudio PannerNode default behavior
summary:
The HRTF panner uses significant memory for the responses and requires a fair amount of processing to implement. For low-end mobile devices, this can be an issue. Since the default panner model is HRTF, the creation of the panner can cause the responses to be loaded.

The default has been changed to equalpower, which doesn't consume significant memory and is much less intensive in processing power.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: minlength attribute
summary: minlength attribute declares a lower bound on the number of characters a user can input.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: reportValidity() for form controls
summary: reportValidity() invokes built-in form validation UI programatically.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: Beacon
summary:
This specification defines an interoperable means for site developers to asynchronously transfer small HTTP data from the User Agent to a web server.

Initiated by the navigator.sendBeacon() method, the 'beacon' data will be transmitted by the User Agent as soon as possible, but independent of document navigation. The sendBeacon method returns true if the user agent is able to successfully queue the data for transfer. Otherwise it returns false.

comments: Firefox is shipping a proprietary API. They are working toward implementing the standard.
visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: Web Application Manifest
summary: This specification defines a JSON-based manifest, which provides developers with a centralized place to put metadata associated with a web application. This includes, but is not limited to, the web application's name, links to icons, as well as the preferred URL to open when the user launches the web application. The manifest also allows developers to declare a default orientation for their web application, as well as how the application is to be displayed by the user agent (e.g. in fullscreen).

comments: Rossen Atanassov from Microsoft is co-editor of the spec.
visibility: Likely in mainstream tech news
name: CSS Shapes Module Level 1
summary:
CSS Shapes allows one to specify a geometric "shape-outside" for a 
float.  Content will wrap around the float's shape-outside, instead of 
its rectangular boundary. The shape-outside property can be specified 
with a geometric primitive, like an ellipse or a polygon, or by the 
pixels of an image's alpha channel whose values are greater than 
shape-image-threshold. A shape-outside's boundary can be uniformly 
expanded with the shape-margin property.

This is a new attribute on the Navigator object.

summary: navigator.languages will expose the Accept Languages and languageevent (fired on the Window object) will notify of a change in this value. The goal is to allow web applications to handle i18n on the client side, thus allowing offline applications to react to user language changes.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: showModalDialog
summary:
The global showModalDialog() method displays a modal dialog box containing a specified HTML document. This feature has an incredibly high cost in terms of code complexity since it requires us to run an event loop on top of an arbitrary JavaScript stack.  It also complicates the web platform by making task dispatch reentrant and hard to reason about. We plan to remove support in Chrome 37.

Details: http://dev.opera.com/blog/showmodaldialog/

This old and prefixed implementation is being deprecated, please watch out for deprecation warnings in the devtools console. We have enabled an unprefixed modern Shadow DOM implementation in M35 (see the latest spec and polymer-dev for additional details on what changed since then)

name: Shadow DOM
summary:
Shadow DOM was enabled in M25 but the spec has gone through quite a few changes since then. This entry is for tracking these changes.

About Shadow DOM: enables DOM tree encapsulation. Without it, widgets may inadvertently break pages by using conflicting CSS selectors, class or id names, or JavaScript variables.

name: CSS Device Adaptation

The @viewport rule, in combination with media queries, enabled web developers to optimize the layout of sites and apps for different devices with minimal effort.

It generalizes the viewport meta tag to CSS, while being much simpler to understand and without the quirks that exists with the meta tag.

name: TLS 1.2
summary: The latest version of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. Uses asymmetric cryptography to assure who is communicating, and to exchange a symmetric key. This session key is then used to encrypt data flowing between the parties. This allows for data/message confidentiality, and message authentication codes for message integrity and as a by-product message authentication.

visibility: Likely in mainstream tech news
name: WebSocket
summary:
The WebSocket JavaScript API provides a simple API for bi-directional communication with web servers.


The WebSocket network protocol enables low overhead bi-directional communication with web servers over a persistent TCP connection.

comments: http://dev.opera.com/articles/view/window-postmessage-messagechannel/#channel

name: Message Channels
summary: A messaging system that allows documents to communicate with each other regardless of their source domain, in a way designed to not enable cross-site scripting attacks.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: NPAPI plug-in support
summary: NPAPI’s 90s-era architecture has become a leading cause of hangs, crashes, security incidents, and code complexity in Chrome. Because of this, Chrome will be phasing out NPAPI support in 2013.

name: Compositing and Blending in Canvas 2D
summary: The canvas 2d context has the globalCompositeOperation attribute that is used to set the current compositing and blending operator.

visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own
name: Mixed Content
summary: User agents disallow rendering and execution of content loaded over unencrypted or unauthenticated connections in the context of an encrypted and authenticated document. In short, the less HTTP in HTTPS documents, the better.

visibility: Only a very small number of web developers will care about
name: Uniform Subscription API
summary: The API would allow users to subscribe to a set of input uniforms which would be automatically populated in their shaders. Decreases perceived latency for operations performed against these uniforms.

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: WebAudio: Deprecate Doppler Effect
summary:
The W3C Audio group has removed the doppler effect from the PannerNode as part of the rework of the PannerNode. (https://github.com/WebAudio/web-audio-api/issues/372).

The methods panner.setVelocity() and listener.setVelocity() and the attributes listener.speedOfSound and listener.dopplerFactor will deprecated with the intent to remove.

comments: Adobe removed Custom Filters code from WebKit in January 2014 due to various reasons https://lists.webkit.org/pipermail/webkit-dev/2014-January/026098.html http://trac.webkit.org/changeset/162644

name: Custom filters (shaders)
summary: Apply OpenGL shaders to arbitrary DOM elements.

name: Lazy layout
summary: Support a system for doing lazy layout based on what elements are visible in the viewport.

name: Pointer Events
summary:
Unified pointer input API subsuming MouseEvent and TouchEvents which addresses several existing problems (especially on touchscreen laptops) and provides future extensibility.

No longer pursuing.  See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=162757#c64

visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com
name: SrcN
summary: SrcN is a responsive images solution which addresses all 3 major use-cases within a single syntax. It addresses DPR switching (like srcset), art-direction (like picture) and viewport dimensions based switching.
